result.execSummary:
The defendant Keon L Shealy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Forgery (Alteration, etc.), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(4)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total Costs and Restitution paid in full by previously posted bond.  Remaining bond to be refunded to the posting party.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment

Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.

Defendant to submit to random testing.

Defendant Keon L Shealy in court with attorney Phillip John Oliver.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the Defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1, count 2 to be dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Counsel as to sentencing.  Court renders judgment.

Plea/sentencing hearing on April 10, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
-Court approved request to remove trial and set for plea and sentencing. Jury clerk notified. Parties notified by email as well.

Attorney Phillip John Oliver appears by telephone. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not in court. Counsel states they did receive an offer from the State, however, offer has not been accepted. Counsel as to double jeopardy in this matter. Response by State. Court signs a final pretrial order. State does not object to impose and stay a warrant. Court issues warrant but stays said warrant until April 10, 2018.

Jury trial on April 10-12, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Judge Moroney presiding on behalf of Judge Voiland. Defendant Keon L Shealy in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant as to counsel. Defendant has spoken with his attorney and his attorney requested a date of March 5, 2018. Court orders final pretrial be scheduled for that date. State confirms date and time for next date.  Jury trial scheduled for March 13-15, 2018 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 5, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Keon L Shealy in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states his attorney will not be able to make it today as his office was broken into. Defendant Keon L Shealy in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has a lawyer, Attorney Phillip Oliver.
